page.title: 15WORDSLEY CARNIVAL
page.content: In 1946 a small garden party was held in{King George V park, {Wordsley.}This led to the{Wordsley {Gala}which was run by the Old People's Welfare until 1976. The event was then taken over by{Holy Trinity {Church}in 1977 and they called it {"Wordsley Carnival." A procession takes place through the streets of{Wordsley}after which the carnival begins. There are about 70 floats taking part. The procession is the biggest in the West Midlands. There are many different types of stalls and numerous interesting events taking place in the large arena. There is also a fun fair which shows a lot of goodwill to the people of{Wordsley}by offering free rides to the handicapped. The money raised is given to needy charities and local churches.
